data.title: Excellent sandwiches, cakes and pastries
data.text: This German bakery has some of the best breads and pastries and makes yummy fresh sandwiches.  They also feature  house-made salads (I like the German potato and pasta salads).  Save room for dessert - they also make freshly baked cookies!

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: I have visited here for breakfast twice and lunch once.  Have been very pleased every time.  The coffee and pastries are excellent and remind me very much of our time living in Germany.  The salad and bread I had at lunch was very fresh and quite excellent.  Definitely a place I will visit again and again.

data.title: Best German Bread, Pastry and Cakes in Area
data.text:
Their bread is wholesome and"pure"--no preservatives!
Almost Bavarian pretzels are great with French Brie.
Their cakes (Torten) remind you of the Konditorei in Stuttgart, Germany.

data.title: GREAT Italian Sandwich
data.text: I love this little bakery downtown.  We have had lunch here a couple of times and I absolutely love their Copa Sandwich!!!  They make their own bread and it is so delicious.  Just thinking about it makes me want to go again.

data.title: Good place for a quick bite and coffee
data.text: One of our favorite spots on a Saturday morning after Pilates. A cup of coffee and a Lox Bagel (for me). Delicious!

data.title: Wonderful sandwiches
data.text: We ordered sandwiches for 10 people for lunch from here.  It was our first time having food from here.  We were very happy with the results.  The bread was fresh, as were the the salads and cold cuts.  .  My whole grain bread was so fresh, it was definitely baked that day.  The soup of the day was a tortilla soup - delicious!  We'll definitely go back here - and pick up a dessert too, as those looked fabulous.

data.title: A Fresh Bakery in Our Little Town!
data.text: Pure Grain serves fresh breads with their sandwiches.  They usually have a variety of breads, which are all delicious.  They don't have much seating inside, bur you're welcome to eat out on the patio area.  On weekends there is usually some form of entertainment to be enjoyed.  We've only eaten lunch here, and the sandwiches are large!  You write your choices on a piece of paper, along with the accoutrements' you desire.  Service is usually fast even on weekends,  The restaurant is roomy inside, and they keep it very clean.  I highly recommend their fresh breads and side salads for a quick pick-me-up lunch.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: A great find while strolling downtown Vacaville with a German influence. We purchased a bear claw and a poppy-seed almond twist for the road, which came recommended, and both were delicious.

data.title: Every thing is ten billion calories so good
data.text: a very good German Bakery lots of good stuff to eat good coffee too people are nice and place is clean this is Bakery is in a nice spot down town Vacaville seating indoors and out great place to hang with friends I go here every Sunday to meet with friends

data.title: Great pastries
data.text: Great pastries, but they tend to not plan for customers in the afternoon and evening, as they run out of things to sell before they close.  Also have coffee drinks and make a very good hot chocolate.

data.title: Great cake and pastries
data.text: My husband and I stopped in on our way to Tahoe because we were here once before. It was really great! The spinach salad and turkey sandwich were good but when we got our desserts, Custard Crumb and Triple Berry cake with house coffee, oh my gosh, love! We will stop in whenever we come through from the Bay Area. Bon appetite.

data.title: Fabulous Coffee shop and Bakery
data.text: Great place for a quick lunch or a coffee and a pastry. Staff are extremely friendly too. I highly recommend Pure Grain Bakery.

data.title: Best sandwiches and bread
data.text: We go out of our way whenever possible when driving to the Bay Area to stop in Vacaville to have lunch here. The bread is always fresh, the build is whatever you want and the staff is always friendly and helpful! Outstanding!

data.title: Good location but average food
data.text: This bakery and coffee house is located in the downtown area of Vacaville and is large with plenty of seating. The staff is pleasant. However, I find the food average and the service very slow. It is unclear why it is so but the food line seems very slow. It takes a long time for food to be prepared and it doesn't seem to matter how busy they are. The very nice location is what saves it for me.

data.title: Best German Bread and Pretzels
data.text: We love the excellent German breads, pretzels, and cakes from this bakery. We also like that their breads are available at the Travis AFB Commissary

data.title: BUSTLING BAKERY
data.text: Fast, efficient service and a great place to have lunch. Not fast food but fun food. The wait staff looking, on average, to be about one third the age of most if the clientele and all wore infectious smiles and seemed to be in a constant state of 'hustle'. The pastries looked wonderful but on this trip we considered them 'off-limits'. Our salad and sandwiches arrived quickly and were first rate. The lunch crowd was large but service and seating were very good. A great place for lunch in Vacaville.

data.title: When I Want Civilized
data.text: My husband and I come here from Sacramento when we want to have "gemutlichkeit" (Look it up!) and want to slip into a peaceful, serene, happy place away from the grind.  Picture sidewalk dining in the old Renoir paintings of people coming together under pleasant, social conditions over good coffee and above average repast, simple and elegant, and tasty pastries and light fare.   This place is a good Germanic bakery with old school breads (The raisin bread is to die for!) and pu pus plus solid coffee and healthy, light salads and sandwiches.  Nice, pleasant conversations fill the air.  Great people watching from the window seats inside or on the patio.  Dog walkers abound.  Clean, civilized, the way going to a restaurant ought to be on a quiet morning.

data.title: Hip Oldsters
data.text: The dining room is lively and busy -- many people coming and going, lots of traffic and fast and efficient service. The clientele, while generally much older than the staff, is hip for its age. The coffee is rich and made to order while the pastries are fresh and wholesome (for pastries). There is free wifi and plenty of seating.

data.title: Great breakfast, great price
data.text: At 6 am I walked through the door at Pure Grain Bakery.   Ordered 2 breakfast sandwiches (egg/ham/cheese), 2 huge latte's, and a loaf of bread.  Walked out for about $20 - and it was all excellent l!!  Wonderful to find a real bakery with both excellent products and great service.
